text: hi my needle drops Anthony Fantan oh
here the Internet's double music nerd
and it's time for an album review the
new subtract LP self-titled this guy is
an anonymous london-based music producer
whose material I could say is electronic
soul all the sounds and the atmosphere
surrounding this album are so clean so
sanitized there's not a speck of dirt on
this LP and normally that would bug me
you guys know how much I like listening
to something grimy every once in a while
but the spotless electronic sounds on
this LP are levelled out with Sam fuzz
voice it's not the most powerful vocal
on the planet but it is a very emotive
one and that's what I like about it so
much though it may be kind of corny to
sing about for example on one track
somebody not calling you back somebody
you're into I still kind of get wrapped
up in the drama I kinda feel for the guy
it just goes to show that delivery is
everything and I kind of dig his range
too he's got a nice warm voice and he
hits some highs too and when he does I
can't tell if he's like straining his
voice a little bit or if he's about to
break out crying
so while Santa's voice is kind of
overheating with emotion on a lot of
these tracks the electronics behind him
sometimes
wrapping around him like a
straightjacket are very calm cool and
collected
sometimes the beats here are very simple
and light and lean like on the track
right thing to do but then again on the
opposite side of the spectrum we have
songs that are very lush very thick very
layered and what I like is no matter
what
side of the spectrum these tracks are on
they always work toward empowering the
emotion that subtractors trying to
convey in a song like on hold on where
the bleak and very sparse music plays
into the loneliness and the lyrics and
never never where the confusing pain of
like losing everything is projected on
to me while I'm listening to it with how
much this song builds how it escalates
how it just throws so many different
sounds and ideas at me at once
there are several female features he
brings on to the album and my favorite
of them is actually you key me from a
little dragon she's on the song wildfire
and her vocals just have so much
personality she was a great addition for
this album and I love what subtract does
with her voice on this song he throws
all sorts of effects on her voice and
progressively changes them as the song
moves along and they're never too
overbearing or distracting I'm always
listening to her singing the other two
vocal features Jessie we're on right
thing to do and roses Gabor on on Pharos
I'm pretty on the fence with them their
voices just don't feel all that distinct
or we're interesting to me they just
kind of get the job done I kind of feel
like I could have heard these vocal
takes like like anywhere but the thing
is the beats underneath their voices are
so good I don't really mind it the song
isn't completely ruined for me the intro
and outro tracks are are all right
they're not highlights for me but
they're good and pretty much everything
outside of those moments is is stellar
for me now I've held off on saying this
until now but I guess you could you
could say this is a a dubstep album I
know that's a kind of a dirty word for
some people that either hate dubstep or
hey seing things labeled as dubstep to
me this album actually sounds like a
dream collaboration between James Blake
and Flying Lotus some of the sounds some
of the really cacophonous layers on this
LP remind me of tracks from flying
lotuses latest EP
except that had a very clean James Blake
production style to them plus Sam FFA's
voice kind of sounds like James Blake's
maybe he's a little less depressing but
he's still kind of a dead ringer having
said that I love this album it's nice to
hear a debut this solid I'm happy to
hear another electronic album I love at
the halfway point of the year I know I
haven't been going crazy over a lot of
electronic LPS this year I've been
listening
I've been looking but I haven't been
binding but I'm happy that now I have
found I'm feeling like a light too
decent eight on this thing it's good I
really enjoyed it links below this video
and on the needle drop comm where you
can hear some of it hmm but what do you
think of this do you love it do you hate
it why and what should I review next
anthony Fantana subtract forever
